perturbation.original_text: Co-Host shall not have the right to assign or otherwise transfer this Agreement or any rights herein granted to any other person or entity, except by operation of law or in connection with the sale of all of its assets, or the acquisition of the Co-Host by a third party. Any such attempted assignment shall be void and the Agreement shall remain in effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Co-Host may assign or otherwise transfer this Agreement or any rights herein granted to any other person or entity, provided that NAI gives written consent. Any such attempted assignment without NAI's written consent shall be void and the Agreement shall remain in effect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly stated that Co-Host is only allowed to assign the contract by operation of law or the sale of its assets. The modified version allows Co-Host to assign the contract as long as NAI approves of it. This creates contradiction about the terms of the assignment.

perturbation.original_text: All the physical Products will be shipped by NAI, F.C.A. (Incoterms 1990) place of shipment. Co-Host is responsible for paying all freight charges, transportation expenses, insurance charges, all applicable taxes, duties, import and export fees and similar charges associated with the delivery of the Products to Co-Host. All shipments will be made using either any carrier approved by both Co-Host and NAI.
perturbation.changed_text: All the physical Products will be shipped by NAI, F.C.A. (Incoterms 1990) place of shipment. NAI is responsible for paying all freight charges, transportation expenses, insurance charges, all applicable taxes, duties, import and export fees and similar charges associated with the delivery of the Products to Co-Host. All shipments will be made using either any carrier approved by both Co-Host and NAI.
perturbation.explanation: In the original contract, Co-Host is responsible for paying all costs. However, in the new contract, the responsibility shifts to NAI, leading to a contradiction between the parties on which one is responsible for the payment of all costs.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein contained, NAI will not issue credit to nor be obligated to accept returns for any reason for any physical Products unless NAI shall have previously issued a written Return Merchandise Authorization ("RMA"). The preceding sentence governs whether or not NAI is obligated to issue an RMA under this Agreement or applicable law. RMAs must be in writing, signed by NAI and only authorize the return of Products in good resalable conditions unless expressly provided otherwise herein. If damaged goods are received pursuant to an RMA, no credit shall be given by NAI with respect to such damaged goods unless the RMA indicates otherwise. Co-Host shall be responsible for all freight charges for goods returned pursuant to an RMA, unless otherwise indicated herein or in the RMA.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein contained, NAI will issue credit and be obligated to accept returns for any reason for any physical Products whether or not NAI shall have previously issued a written Return Merchandise Authorization ("RMA"). The preceding sentence governs whether or not NAI is obligated to issue an RMA under this Agreement or applicable law. RMAs must be in writing, signed by NAI and only authorize the return of Products in good resalable conditions unless expressly provided otherwise herein. If damaged goods are received pursuant to an RMA, credit shall be given by NAI with respect to such damaged goods unless the RMA indicates otherwise. NAI shall be responsible for all freight charges for goods returned pursuant to an RMA, unless otherwise indicated herein or in the RMA.
perturbation.explanation: In the original contract, NAI is not responsible for credit or accepting returns unless there is an RMA. However, in the new contract, NAI is responsible for accepting and giving credit back whether or not they issued an RMA in the first place. This creates contradiction between the parties on which conditions does NAI needs to abide by in order to accept returns.
